}
#diclWrapper .filters-radio input[type=radio] + label:before,
#diclWrapper .filters-radio input[type=radio] + label:after {
  content: "";

  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  width: 16px;
  height: 16px;
  text-align: center;
  color: white;
  font-family: "adelle-sans-condensed", sans-serif;
  font-style: normal;
  font-weight: 400;
  font-size: 16px;
  line-height: 95%;
  border: 1px solid;

  transition: all 0.3s ease;
}

}
#diclWrapper .filters-radio input[type=radio] + label:hover:before {

}

/* Tooltip CSS */
.d3-tip {
  line-height: 1.5;
  font-weight: 400;
  font-family: "avenir next", Arial, sans-serif;
  padding: 6px;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
  color: #fff;
  border-radius: 1px;
  pointer-events: none;
}

/* Creates a small triangle extender for the tooltip */
.d3-tip:after {
  box-sizing: border-box;
  display: inline;
  font-size: 8px;
  width: 100%;
  line-height: 1.5;
  color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.6);
  position: absolute;
  pointer-events: none;
}

/* Northward tooltips */
/* Eastward tooltips */
.d3-tip.e:after {
  content: "◀";
  margin: -4px 0 0 0;
  top: 50%;
  left: -8px;
}

/* Southward tooltips */
.d3-tip.s:after {
  content: "▲";
  margin: 0 0 1px 0;
  top: -8px;
  left: 0;
  text-align: center;
}

/* Westward tooltips */
.d3-tip.w:after {
  content: "▶";
  margin: -4px 0 0 -1px;
  top: 50%;
  left: 100%;
}

.d3-tip {
  background: #ffffff !important;
  border: 1px solid #cccccc !important;
  border-radius: 4px !important;
  padding: 8px !important;
  font-family: "adelle-sans-condensed", sans-serif !important;
  font-weight: 400 !important;
  font-size: 16px !important;
  line-height: 20px !important;
  color: #1f1f1f !important;
}

.d3-tip span,
.d3-tip p {
  font-family: "adelle-sans-condensed", sans-serif !important;
  font-weight: 400 !important;
  font-size: 14px !important;
  line-height: 20px !important;
  color: #666666 !important;
  margin-bottom: 0 !important;
}

.d3-tip p.d3-tip-stat {
  font-family: "adelle-sans-condensed", sans-serif !important;
  font-weight: 400 !important;
  font-size: 16px !important;
  line-height: 20px !important;
  color: #1f1f1f !important;
  margin-bottom: 0 !important;
}

.d3-tip strong,
.d3-tip p.d3-tip-stat span {
  font-family: "adelle-sans-condensed", sans-serif !important;
  font-weight: 700 !important;
  font-size: 16px !important;
  line-height: 20px !important;
  color: #1f1f1f !important;
}

    .multiselect-dropdown{
      display: inline-block;
      padding: 2px 5px 0px 5px;
      border-radius: 4px;
      border: solid 1px #ced4da;
      background-color: white;
      position: relative;
      background-image: url("data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 16 16'%3e%3cpath fill='none' stroke='%23343a40' stroke-linecap='round' stroke-linejoin='round' stroke-width='2' d='M2 5l6 6 6-6'/%3e%3c/svg%3e");
      background-repeat: no-repeat;
      background-position: right .75rem center;
      background-size: 16px 12px;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown span.optext, .multiselect-dropdown span.placeholder{
      margin-right:0.5em; 
      margin-bottom:2px;
      padding:1px 0; 
      border-radius: 4px; 
      display:inline-block;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown span.optext{
      background-color:lightgray;
      padding:1px 0.75em; 
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown span.optext .optdel {
      float: right;
      margin: 0 -6px 1px 5px;
      font-size: 0.7em;
      margin-top: 2px;
      cursor: pointer;
      color: #666;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown span.optext .optdel:hover { color: #c66;}
    .multiselect-dropdown span.placeholder{
      color:#ced4da;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list-wrapper{
      box-shadow: gray 0 3px 8px;
      z-index: 100;
      padding:2px;
      border-radius: 4px;
      border: solid 1px #ced4da;
      display: none;
      margin: -1px;
      position: absolute;
      top:0;
      left: 0;
      right: 0;
      background: white;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list-wrapper .multiselect-dropdown-search{
      margin-bottom:5px;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list{
      padding:2px;
      height: 15rem;
      overflow-y:auto;
      overflow-x: hidden;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list::-webkit-scrollbar {
      width: 6px;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list::-webkit-scrollbar-thumb {
      background-color: #bec4ca;
      border-radius:3px;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list div{
      padding: 5px;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list input{
      height: 1.15em;
      width: 1.15em;
      margin-right: 0.35em;  
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list div.checked{
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown-list div:hover{
      background-color: #ced4da;
    }
    .multiselect-dropdown span.maxselected {width:100%;}
    .multiselect-dropdown-all-selector {border-bottom:solid 1px #999;}

<script type="text/javascript">
	 function loadScript(scriptURL){
        // load script
        var scriptTAG = document.createElement('script');
        scriptTAG.type = 'application/javascript';
        scriptTAG.async = true;
        scriptTAG.src = scriptURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(scriptTAG);
      }

      function loadCSS(CSSURL){
        // load css
        var linkTAG = document.createElement('link');
        linkTAG.rel = "stylesheet";
        linkTAG.type = 'text/css';
        linkTAG.href = CSSURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(linkTAG);
      }
      if(!navigator.onLine){
      	loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.css');
        loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site.min.css');
        loadScript('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.js');
      	templateType = dataLayer.page.attributes.pageTemplate;
        // for event details template
      	if(templateType == "Event_Details_Page_Template"){
      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-critical/clientlib-critical-event-details.min.css');
      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-event-details.min.css');
      	}
        // for blog post template
      	else if(templateType == "Blog_Post_Template"){
      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-critical/clientlib-critical-blog-post.min.css')
      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-blog-post.min.css')
      	}
        // for DI Article and multimedia
        else if(templateType == "Deloitte_Insights_Article_And_Multimedia_Template"){
          loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/deloitte-insights/clientlibs/clientlib-critical/clientlib-critical-di-insights-and-multimedia.min.css');
          loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/deloitte-insights/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-di-article-multimedia.min.css');
        }
      }

    <section id="cover">
      <div class="container">
        <div class="row cover-row">
          <div class="col-lg-6 col-12">
            <div class="cover-data">
              <h1>ConsumerSignals</h1>
              <p>
                ConsumerSignals is a longitudinal exploration of consumer spending behavior and the drivers behind it. Every month, we survey thousands of
                consumers across more than a dozen countries about their sense of financial well-being, spending intentions, and upcoming purchases big and
                small—from their next trip to the grocery store to upcoming vacations, next vehicle purchase, and more.
              </p>
              <p>
                Now in its third year, ConsumerSignals provides a view into consumers’ everyday finances and the spending strategies being used to navigate an
                unpredictable world. We invite you to explore our interactive data dashboard, collection of proprietary consumer indices, and deep-dive
                articles.
                <button data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:popover-toggle" type="button" class="btn-popover" aria-label="Learn more" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-content="Research methodology
                                      <li>Online consumer panel</li>
                                      <li>N=1,000 consumers per country each wave, adults age 18+</li>
                                      <li>Country margin of error ±3% (does not apply to averages of two or more study countries)</li>
                                      <li>Response data for Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Netherlands, South Korea, Spain, United Kingdom, and the United States are weighted at the country level according to publicly available age and income profiles</li>
                                      <li>Response data for Brazil, China, India, Mexico, and South Africa, are not weighted by income. Data represents higher-income consumers compared to national income distributions. Soft quotas and weighting are used to hold sample income distributions consistent wave to wave</li>" data-original-title="Learn More">
                  <span></span>
                </button>
              </p>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="col-lg-6 col-12">
            <div class="stat-col">
              <h5>Global financial well-being</h5>
              <div class="row">
                <div class="col-lg-12">
                  <h2>103.7</h2>
                  <p>The global financial well-being index decreased to 103.7 in August, down from 104.5 last month, and up from 102.4 a year ago.</p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="row nav-row">
          <div class="nav-col-2">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-12">
                <h6>Financial and spending sentiment</h6>
              </div>
              <div class="col-lg-6 nav-col no-border">
                <h4>Financial well-being</h4>
                <p>Financial well-being sentiment finds some stability following a long spell of volatility likely due to global inflation.</p>
                <a data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:explore-financial-wellbeing" class="fade-scroll" href="#financial-wellbeing">Explore financial well-being</a>
              </div>
              <div class="col-lg-6 nav-col">
                <h4>Spending intent</h4>
                <p>After almost one year since inflation stunted global spending confidence, spending intentions have gradually recovered to 2021 levels.</p>
                <a data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:explore-spending-intent" class="fade-scroll" href="#spending-intent">Explore spending intent</a>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="nav-col-3">
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-12">
                <h6>Jump to Sector Insights</h6>
              </div>
              <div class="col-lg-4 nav-col no-border">
                <h4>Retail & consumer products</h4>
                <p>
                  The global food frugality index (FFI) has remained slightly below the September 2022 baseline for much of 2023, suggesting consumers are being
                  slightly less frugal at the grocery store.
                </p>
                <a data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:explore-retail-and-consumer-products" class="fade-scroll" href="#retail-consumer-products">Explore retail & consumer products</a>
              </div>
              <div class="col-lg-4 nav-col">
                <h4>Travel & hospitality</h4>
                <p>Booking intentions for major travel segments, including hotel and air travel, remain even year over year.</p>
                <a data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:explore-travel-and-hospitality" class="fade-scroll" href="#travel-hospitality">Explore travel & hospitality</a>
              </div>
              <div class="col-lg-4 nav-col">
                <h4>Automotive</h4>
                <p>Vehicle purchase intent continues a long-term downtrend, but trends vary by country.</p>
                <a data-analytics-label="deloitte-global-state-of-the:explore-automotive" class="fade-scroll" href="#automotive">Explore automotive</a>
              </div>

                  <div class="facebook-button social-button" tabindex="0" role="button" aria-label="Social media facebook" type="button" data-toggle="tooltip-none" data-placement="bottom" data-analytics-label="financial-wellbeing:link-linktoFacebook-share" data-analytics-type="facebook" title="Facebook">

                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="row">
              <div class="col-12 intro-col">
                <h2>Financial well-being</h2>
                <p>
                  Deloitte's financial well-being index (FWBI) captures changes in how consumers are feeling about their present-day financial health and future
                  financial security. Unlike consumer confidence indices, which often focus on consumer opinion about economic conditions (e.g., health of the
                  economy or labor market), the financial well-being index focuses on the consumer’s own financial experience, where they’re the experts.
                  <button data-analytics-label="financial-wellbeing:popover-toggle" type="button" class="btn-popover" aria-label="Learn more" data-toggle="tooltip" data-placement="bottom" title="" data-content="
                                              Deloitte’s financial well-being index (FWBI) measures changes in the percentage of survey respondents who feel neutral, positive, or very positive for each of the following six dimensions of financial health. Higher index values indicate stronger financial well-being. (April 2020 = 100 [unless noted otherwise]) 
                                              <ul>
                                              <li>Confidence in the ability to make upcoming payments</li>
                                              <li>Comfort with level of savings</li>
                                              <li>Income relative to spending</li>
                                              <li>Delays in making large purchases</li>
                                              <li>Assessment of current financial situation relative to the prior year</li>
                                              <li>Expectations of financial situation for the year ahead</li>
                                              </ul>
                                              The global index line represents an average of eight of the top 10 global economies by 2022 GDP according to World Bank. <br/>
                                              Japan: September 2020 = 100<br/>
                                              Brazil: September 2021 = 100<br/>
                                              India, Mexico: September 2022 = 100" data-original-title="Learn More">
                    <span></span>
                  </button>
                </p>

                <hr>
              </div>

                <div class="col-12">
                  <h4>Deloitte's financial well-being index (FWBI)</h4>
                  <p>April 2020 = 100 (unless noted otherwise)</p>

              <div class="chart-row row">
                <div class="col-md-9 chart">

                  <h6>How we measure financial well-being</h6>
                  <div class="">
                    <p>Financial well-being is measured across six dimensions of financial health (details in the info button above).</p>
                    <p>Higher index values indicate stronger financial well-being.</p>
                    <p>The global index line represents an average of eight of the top 10 global economies by 2022 GDP according to World Bank.</p>

                    <h6>KEY TAKEAWAYS</h6>
                    <p>
                      Concern around rising prices persists and remains widespread, but inflation sentiment varies significantly by country. The percentage
                      expecting higher gas/fuel prices is back on the rise.
                    </p>

            <p><strong>Age: </strong><span>All</span></p>

            <hr></div></div>
                  <h6>Methodology Note</h6>
                  <p>
                    Spending intentions are represented using a three-month exponential moving average (EMA). An exponential moving average (EMA) is a type of
                    moving average that places more weight on recent data points, making it more responsive to recent price changes compared to a simple moving
                    average (SMA). EMA is commonly used to smooth out data and help visualize long-term trends.
                  </p>
                  <p>Non-discretionary categories were recategorized to include housing, transportation, groceries, and health care.</p>
                  <p class="source">Source: Deloitte research from November 2021 to present.</p>
                </div>

                  <div class="border-left col-lg-8 key-take-col">
                    <h6>KEY TAKEAWAYS</h6>
                    <p>Global total spending intentions held steady in September compared to last month and are even compared to a year ago.</p>

                  <h6>What is the FFI?</h6>
                  <p>Everyone needs to eat, but food is becoming less affordable for some.</p>
                  <p>
                    The FFI is a monthly proprietary measure of behaviors associated with financial stress at the grocery store—and how they may be shaping the
                    way consumers shop for food.
                  </p>
                  <p>Higher index values indicate consumers cite being more frugal.</p>
                  <p class="source">Source: Deloitte research from September 2022 to present.</p>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>

              <div class="col-lg-9">
                <div class="row">
                  <div class="border-left col-lg-8 key-take-col">
                    <h6>KEY Takeaways</h6>
                    <p>
                      The global food frugality index held steady at 97.6 in August, up slightly from 97.4 last month, and down slightly from 97.9 a year ago.
                    </p>

                  <h6>Methodology Note</h6>

                    From September 2021 to August 2022, respondents cited their perception of current prices compared to the prior month. Starting in September
                    2022, respondents cited their expectations of prices in the upcoming month.

    function getCookie(name) 
    {
        var dc = document.cookie;
        var prefix = name + "=";
        var begin = dc.indexOf("; " + prefix);
        if (begin == -1) {
            begin = dc.indexOf(prefix);
            if (begin != 0) return null;
        }
        else
        {
            begin += 2;
            var end = document.cookie.indexOf(";", begin);
            if (end == -1) {
                end = dc.length;
            }
        }
        return unescape(dc.substring(begin + prefix.length, end));
    }
